findings.description: Private cryptographic key found in version control
findings.remediation: Generate new private keys immediately and revoke the exposed ones. Store keys in secure secret management systems.

findings.description: AWS access key found in environment file
findings.remediation: Rotate the exposed AWS credentials immediately. Use AWS Secrets Manager or environment variables outside of version control.

findings.description: Hardcoded database password in configuration file
findings.remediation: Move database credentials to environment variables or secure secret storage. Use connection strings without embedded passwords.

findings.description: Potential API key matching common patterns
findings.remediation: Verify if this is a test key. If production, rotate immediately and store in secure environment variables.

immediate_actions: Rotate all exposed AWS credentials immediately
Generate new private keys and revoke the exposed ones
Move credentials to secure secret management systems
prevention: Store secrets in dedicated secret managers
development_practices: Use test credentials that are clearly marked as such
Never commit real credentials, even in private repositories
Regular security scanning in CI/CD pipelines
